First I'd like to say I thoroughly enjoy this game and have a love for it that keeps me coming back. I almost exclusively play Killer. 

Graphics - 8/10 : Style 10/10. It is better to play this game on lowest settings as you can see the game a little better but it still looks great.

Combat system - 8/10 : Each Killer has unique abilities and both Killers and Survivors perks that can personalize gameplay and make up the progression system.

UI - 10/10 : It is clean and functional, all you really need.

Lore - 10/10 : Perfect for your inner serial killer or horror movie survivor fantasies. 

Quests - 6/10 : There are dailies that can keep you engaged but it is frustrating when you get daily quests for a role which you don't play.

Difficulty - 7/10 : Variable as there is a ranking system that attempts to match according to relative skill. Sometimes though you will face less skilled players at high rank and vice versa. As a Killer main, the biggest detriment to a good experience is playing against SWF (survive with friends) teams.

Overall Gameplay - 7/10 : Fun game and it scratches a specific itch. Though, I wish BHVR would understand the game on a deeper level and listen to some different influencers. Survivors are currently OP and Killers UP but there is a lack of understanding on their part as to why. https://youtu.be/qnwdPlx9yR4

Final Score - 7/10 : This game could be a 10/10 if devs understood the game at lower (i.e. higher) rank than 15 and above. 

Purchase Recommendation : Buy on Sale

I may only have about 89 hours on the game however i do believe in a few things that i think should be added.
Firstly i believe that the game should be cheaper after being out for 3 years and there is lots of DLC because i know that a few of my friends would definitely buy this game if it was cheaper. Recently there was a sale and a free weekend but the sale lasted a very short amount of time and my friends didn't realise that it would be over so soon so didn't buy it. If the game was cheaper more people would play most likely as seen by the free weekend player peak but also this means that more people may enjoy the game as there will be more new players so a nice welcoming into the game and also a shorter lobby wait time. This may encourage people to buy DLC as some of it is actually quite interesting ( i have Myers and Saw ).

Secondly i would also like to promote the idea of a 2 killer game mode or just some extra game modes because the game can get repetitive sometimes and when you are playing with friends you sometimes want to play the killer however you may not have enough for a custom 5 man lobby so only have the choice of playing solo killer or surviving together and that isn't the greatest variety of options.

Overall i do recommend this game as it is great fun especially with friends, unless u get tunnelled and camped, and i really do hope to see some big improvements to the game as i have owned the game for quite a while and there hasn't really been much super exciting news other than new killers and survivors.

bah meu

I almost want to recommend it.

The game is fun. Until you meet the people in it.

The killers are toxic in how they tunnel and chase only one person.
The survivors are toxic in nearly everything they do.
There are only about 7 useful survivor perks.
There are only about 5 useful killer perks.
The game lags constantly.
The game sometimes forces you to disconnect, then punishes you for it.
Moris are overpowered and unpleasant since there is nothing you can do to stop them.
Random people leave you behind for no reason.
The ranked system doesn't put people of equal skill level together.

This game is most definitely pay to win, given the cost of everything and the number of hours you would need to put in to get anything worthwhile.

After playing for 212 hours, I still have only unlocked 2 characters beyond the original ones.

The best killers are locked behind a literal pay wall, and their perks are the ones required to succeed as killer.

Overall, this game may be fun, but the current community and state of the game is not good enough to warrant buying it.
